result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abdullah M Hasan

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ( $10,000.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $10000.00

10:57am Defendant Abdullah M Hasan not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Abdullah M Hasan appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed. nk

Defendant Abdullah M Hasan in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Abdullah M Hasan in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Abdullah M Hasan not in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/17/22 @ 1:30p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-17- @1:30p
